alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Dallas; Grant; Jefferson (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 12 at 9:02AM CDT until May 12 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Grant County in central Arkansas... Northwestern Cleveland County in southeastern Arkansas... Southwestern Jefferson County in southeastern Arkansas... Central Dallas County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until noon CDT. * At 902 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pine Bluff, White Hall, Carthage, Lamont, Sulphur Springs, Ain, Farindale, Bunn, Millerville, Grapevine, Cross Roads in Grant County, Staves, Princeton, Tulip, Willow, Faith, Hardin and Watson Chapel. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
